Hello,

I want to perform simulations of a counter flow flame with Cantera =
via
the Matlab Interface. I am using the n-Heptane mechanism from Held97.
T=
he mechanism is distributed with a transport data file. I have
converted th=
e chemkin style input files to a cti file with the
executable distributed w=
ith Cantera. The transport data seems to shows
up in the cti file. When I t=
ry to set the transport model in Matlab I
get an error:

gas =3D IdealGasMi=
x('held.cti','Multi')
??? 

***********************************************=
*
                Cantera Error!                  
************************=
************************


Procedure: xml_find_id
Error:   id not found: Mu=
lti

Error in =3D=3D> XML_Node.findByID at 4
index =3D ctmethods(10, 8, roo=
t.id, id);

Error in =3D=3D> Solution.Solution at 34
  node =3D findByID(do=
c,id);

Error in =3D=3D> IdealGasMix at 41
       s =3D Solution(a, b);

It=
 seems like Cantera is looking for a string in the input file which
does no=
t exist. If I do not specify the transport model, the flame
simulation runs=
 just fine. However I dont know which transport model
is used in this case.=
 Can anybody help me with this?
